snippet: Although there is still no certainty that Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 has crashed, lawyers are pursuing families that might be granted multimillion-dollar settlements.
abstract: Lawyers are rushing to secure compensation for families of 227 passengers who went missing with Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, even though there is still no certainty flight has crashed; families may be awarded millions of dollars per passenger and may opt to sue Malaysia Airlines, Boeing or component manufacturer; some families, still grappling to accept deaths of loved ones, are reluctant to immediately pursue legal action.

byline.original: By EDWARD WONG and KIRK SEMPLE
byline.contributor: Edward Wong reported from Beijing, and Kirk Semple from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Nicola Clark contributed reporting from Paris. Amy Qin, Mia Li and Bree Feng contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Although there is still no certainty that Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 has crashed, lawyers are pursuing families that might be granted multimillion-dollar settlements.

headline.main: With Plane Still Missing, Legal Moves for Payouts Start
headline.print_headline: With Plane Still Missing, Legal Moves for Payouts Start
